intro: Arctotis vitellina, commonly known as the golden marguerite, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features bright yellow ray flowers surrounding a central disk of smaller florets, creating a striking appearance. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and prefers full sun with well-drained soil. Arctotis vitellina is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its vibrant blooms and drought tolerance.
